seg.seg: ... like a lotus flower, with joy. 2 || Thereupon the venerable
(Metrak) ... placing ... says: || In the Subhadra [tune] || With the sting of mercy
... on the order of the Cakravartin-king, making glad in all lands the followers of the Vinaya, ...
... at the invitation of ... to go to the king of the sages. 1 || Having said so much, the venerable (Metrak)
... Bādhari the Brahmin, with his body trembling excessively because of his advanced age, his palms placed together,
... will pay his respect. You, my sons, have heard from me the words of the god. See yourselves ... the Buddha-god(s)
... I will grant the permission to them to go to the presence of (the Buddha-god) the teacher. See, oh good ones! || In the Pañcama [tune] || The gods have been allowed, the goddesses (?)
... from the ... houses they are descending, they are coming to the human beings; they are combining their homage to the Buddha-god with their wish to be freed.
... merciful one. 1. Therefore, you, give up the self-torments of heretics, tasteless ones, the observances of magic skills
... (when) your wish is to see him. Go away from the house to the Buddha-god, (you) whose wish it is to become freed! 2. || Thereupon, the venerable
… whose wish it is to see him. Go away from the house to the Buddha, (you [pl.]) whose wish it is to become freed! (cf 79)
(Metrak) /// is ready to go away from the house to the venerable Buddha-god the teacher. Having seen that, ... (beginning with) Tiṣya,
... not wishing to be separated from the venerable Metrak, with eyes filled with tears, with (the palms of their hands placed together)
... || In the Pañcagati [tune] || The love for father and mother (is) the strongest (sentiment) among the beings
... surpassed ..., what is to be asked of a father? Have mercy on us, oh merciful one!
... says: All the time it has been my expectation to hear just this from you. See, oh good ones!
... Whosoever intends to put an end to Saṃsāra the master,
Whosoever intends to put an end to the saṃsāra, the master. (cf 79)

p.note: This fragment contains part of the second act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka. Line b8 here is the same as a1; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami II, 3 (missing)-4a20; line b3 here correlates with MaitrHami II, 4a1. See also 195-6.
The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 80.
kātkṣant i-: according to 281kātkṣanti, nom.sg. of a feminine derivative of an ag.n. kātkṣant.
pañcmaṃ: two stanzas of 4 x 14 (7/7) syllables.
Cf. MaitrHami 2, 4 a1ff (for the Uy. references, see 18), and the end of this leaf corresponds roughly to MaitrHami 2, 4 a19ff.

pañcagatinaṃ: a stanza of 4 x 21 (8/7/6) + 21 (id.) + 18 (9/9) + 13 (7/6) syllables; this scheme is met with the corresponding name of the tune in TB: pañcagatine, cf. : a5. For the following speech, compare MaitrHami 2, 4 a6-14.
Maitreya (Metrak) is now speaking, cf. MaitrHami 2, 4 a15ff.
